userreviews.userReview: [Harriet is actually Jacob's half sister ! (hide spoiler)]
Too much angst due to OW https://www.goodreads.com/review/show...

Traditional Regency beautifully written. Probably not for anyone that isn't interested in multiple misunderstandings and personal angst etc, but I really enjoyed the fact that (for a change) there were no 'bad guys' no 'action' no chases etc. This was all about the people and the relationships. There were lots of minor characters, but they stayed in the background as wallpaper.Lots of romantic tension but only a small amount of actual steam hinted at. That said, this book was so interesting, it didn't need it. I felt like I was in regency England.PS - There WAS a 'bad girl' and she was REALLY dreadful - I commend the author, as I really hated her.

nice novelbut only thatat first I loved that Em is so sure of Jacob and was so sorry to see her disappointment I loved that she kept making excuses for him at first and kept expecting him to declare his love fer her till Harriet interferedbut I really hated when Em agreed to marry Charles , and their kiss scene was just horribleEm became this practical seducing woman instead of the romantic witty girl but the ending was nice and I loved the twist when Harriet turned out to be Jacob's sister
[I saw that twist on her parentage about a mile away, but it was worth it for her reaction. (hide spoiler)]

Some of it seemed rather implausible, but it was engagingly written. Unfortunately, it's another book where the hero and heroine could have fixed up a few things with some simple communication rather than just believing what had been told to them.
I liked it, the "villian" in this piece I would have knocked out...oh my goodness what a terrible vicious piece of skirt.

description: Emily Hughes has her sights set on one man: Jacob Winters, Earl of Hawthorne. But her hopes are dashed when she discovers that Jacob has been betrothed to another since birth! Now, Emily must end her infatuation and find a husband. In no time at all, she finds herself engaged to another-until one moonlit kiss changes everything...
title: Emily's Beau
